text: Brunellia is a genus of trees. They are distributed in the mountainous regions of southern Mexico, Central America, West Indies, and South America.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesDavidse, G., M. Sousa Sánchez, S. Knapp & F. Chiang Cabrera. 2013. Vitaceae a Geraniaceae. 3(1): ined. In G. Davidse, M. Sousa Sánchez, S. Knapp & F. Chiang Cabrera (eds.) Flora Mesoamericana. Universidad de Antioquia, MedellínNelson, C. H. 2008. Catálogo de las Plantas Vasculares de Honduras 1–1576. Secretaria de Recursos Naturales y Ambiente, Tegucigalpa Brunellia is the only genus in the family Brunelliaceae. As of 2001 there were about 54 species.Orozco, C. I. (2001). Pollen morphology of Brunellia (Brunelliaceae) and related taxa in the Cunoniaceae.
